page.title: 12Arable Farm 1:The Deverills
page.content: {Woodcombe Farm}has been a family farm since{1898.}It is a large farm of{65O {acres}covering part of{Cold Kitchen {Hill.}Roughly half of this is crops, 32O-33O acres of cereal and the rest permanent pasture. The fields vary in size from the smallest fields of one and a half acres to the biggest fields of 47 acres. The farmer grows several different crops, winter wheat and oats, spring wheat and barley. Winter wheat has the greatest acreage. The wheat varieties grown are Avalon, a milling variety which has a high protein value and Rapier and Norman which are grown for feed.The crops are grown in a seven year rotation, five years of grain then two years of grass ley. The wheat gives an average of three tons an acre. The farmer also keeps 25O store cattle, Hereford Friesian cross and sells them for beef
